entry.title: CFTC Orders Two Florida Men to Pay $5.4 Million in Bitcoin Fraud Case
entry.summary: Investors never received a satoshi of Bitcoin, despite what they were promised.

entry.title: New York City Law Aimed at Curbing AI Bias Goes Into Effect
entry.summary: As AI tools are rapidly adopted by businesses, the New York City law aims to prevent bias in employment decisions.

entry.title: The Most Anticipated Crypto and NFT Games
entry.summary: Lavish titles like Illuvium, Shrapnel, and Otherside are poised to redefine blockchain gaming. Here's what to watch for in 2023 and beyond.

entry.title: US Military Is Training AI to Give Orders and Handle State Secrets
entry.summary: How close is AI to making decisions on the battlefield? A U.S. Air Force colonel says tests have been "highly successful" so far.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Bitfinex Recovers $314K of the $3.6 Billion Stolen in 2016 Bitcoin Hack
entry.summary: The crypto exchange today announced it had recovered cash and Bitcoin Cash from the notorious hack. But there is still a lot to be recovered.

entry.title: Institutions Are Holding More Bitcoin Than Ever Before, Says Ark Invest
entry.summary: Bitcoin balances on over-the-counter trading desks, which Ark Invests uses as a proxy for institutions, is up 60% over the last quarter.

entry.title: Bad Blood? FTX Called It Off With Taylor Swift, Not the Other Way Around: Reports
entry.summary: Taylor Swift reportedly signed the proposed $100 million deal, contrary to previous claims, but NYT sources now say that FTX’s founder backed out.

entry.title: Bitcoin Tax Evasion Can’t Be Stopped With Just Anti-Money Laundering: IMF Report
entry.summary: “Whether crypto withers or blossoms, the tax system still needs to deal with it,” the IMF authors wrote.

entry.title: Circle Is Now Closer to Launching Its Coinbase Wallet-Building Competitor
entry.summary: The fintech firm is helping developers add crypto wallets to their applications.

entry.title: DeFi Traders Lost $228 Million to Hackers in 3 Months
entry.summary: The overall number of hacks has increased by 65% and losses from fraud rocketed up by 225%.

entry.title: Eyeball Pool Puts an NFT Twist on the Classic 8-Ball Game
entry.summary: Developed by co-creators of the billion-downloaded 8 Ball Pool, the iOS and Android game will be built on Immutable zkEVM.

entry.title: Meta’s ‘Twitter Killer’ Threads Onboards Millions, But They Could Lose Their Instagram Accounts
entry.summary: Meta claims the new text-based app has attracted over 10 million users in its first hours. But it has also committed them to policies that could result in the unwanted deletion of millions of Instagram accounts.

entry.title: Abracadabra Money Mulls Registering DAO as Centralized Legal Body
entry.summary: Abracadabra Money’s team leader had put forward a proposal to form to introduce "a certain degree of centralized legal structure" for its DAO.

entry.title: Decentralized Twitter Rival Bluesky Announces $8M Fundraise, Paid Services
entry.summary: Twitter competitor Bluesky has announced a $8 million seed round and introduced its first paid service.

entry.title: Tron Launches HackaTron Season 5 Alongside Builder Tour
entry.summary: The fifth season of Tron’s popular hackathon, in collaboration with BitTorrent Chain and Huobi Ventures, kicks off July 6.

entry.title: CFTC Mulls Filing Fresh Case Against Celsius Network, Former CEO Mashinsky: Report
entry.summary: Celsius' former CEO Alex Mashinsky reportedly misled investors before the crypto lender's spectacular collapse last year.

entry.title: The Boldest Blockchain Hacks Ever
entry.summary: In 2022, a record $3.8 billion in cryptocurrency was stolen as a result of targeted attacks and hacks.

entry.title: AI is Okay, But Artists Still Need to Get Paid: Musician Emily Lazar
entry.summary: "This is evolution," she says. "This is going to happen, whether we like it or not."

entry.title: Twitter Awarded Three State Money Transmitter Licenses
entry.summary: It's the latest step toward realizing Elon Musk's vision of an "everything app," the Web3 WeChat of the west.

entry.title: This Diamond-Packed Apple Watch Cuff Is Authenticated by an NFT
entry.summary: La Maison Steel debuted the luxury Apple Watch accessories on Tuesday in Paris. They feature an embedded NFC chip tied to a Polygon NFT.

entry.title: Threads Is Live, as Meta Launches Its Twitter Rival Early
entry.summary: "Hello world" posts are flooding into the timeline of the brand new text-based social network.

entry.title: How Ubisoft, Roblox, and Blizzard Are Using AI to Make Next-Generation Games
entry.summary: Game studios are turning to AI to automate the most tedious elements of development and instantly conjure characters.

entry.title: AI Could Unlock the Language of Proteins: Meet Ankh, the Protein Whisperer
entry.summary: In the same way ChatGPT understands language, Ankh understands proteins, creating a pathway to advances in medicine, biology, and energy.

entry.title: Did Blur Really Crash the NFT Market?
entry.summary: With prices fading, NFT traders are blaming marketplace Blur and its flipping incentives—as Blur’s founder decries “bad takes.”

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Revenue Hits $184 Million in Q2 Amid Ordinals Fervor
entry.summary: The experimental class of tokens has delivered a healthy quarterly sum to miners, analysis shows.

entry.title: BlackRock Boss Larry Fink Praises Bitcoin for ‘Digitizing Gold’
entry.summary: Once dismissing the top cryptocurrency as a money laundering tool, he’s now singing a different tune.

entry.title: Are We Back? Crypto Analysts Split on Bitcoin’s Bull Run
entry.summary: There's no easy answer on how long Bitcoin will rally, but investors were split on their forecasts.

entry.title: Valkyrie Updates Bitcoin ETF Filing, Lists Coinbase as ‘Surveillance-Sharing’ Partner
entry.summary: The language on surveilling Bitcoin spot markets for fraud now echoes what BlackRock put in its own updated ETF filing.

entry.title: Binance CEO Says 'The Larger The Better' on Blackrock Bitcoin ETF
entry.summary: “We welcome more players, the larger the better,” said Zhao, explaining that “it will offer more coverage.”

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Largest Bank in Southeast Asia Is Adding Support for China's CBDC
entry.summary: Singapore-based DBS Bank is allowing clients to make e-CNY payments.

entry.title: Ethereum Scaler Starknet Launches Testnet for Latest 'Quantum Leap' Upgrade
entry.summary: If the Starknet community approves, the latest upgrade to the popular Ethereum scaling solution will hit mainnet next week.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum CME Contracts Hit $46.8B in Trading Volume Last Month
entry.summary: Amid the latest flurry of Bitcoin ETF refilings, institutional investors appear to be taking a second look at the largest cryptocurrencies.

entry.title: Tezos Generative Art Platform fxhash Adds Ethereum in Multichain Push
entry.summary: Tezos generative art platform fxhash is expanding to include Ethereum, marking its evolution into a multichain model.

entry.title: Binance Halts Deposits and Withdrawals on 10 Multichain-Bridged Tokens
entry.summary: Binance previously suspended deposits of the ten tokens after some transactions on the Multichain protocol froze back in May.

entry.title: Crypto Storage Token Storj Hits 10-Month High Overnight
entry.summary: Crypto storage token Storj has seen its market capitalization double overnight as trading volumes for the asset surge in South Korea.

entry.title: Canadian Police Say Investigation Into Crypto Crime Involving Coinbase 'Did Not Occur'
entry.summary: The Hamilton Police issued a public statement denying that any investigation into an alleged $4.2 million crypto crime had occurred.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcardia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title—and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents—and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.title: Are NFTs the Next SEC Target?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.

entry.title: Collab.Land Co-Founder Said There Was No ‘Aha Moment’ When Launching DAO Toolkit
entry.summary: CCO and co-founder of Collab.Land Anjali Young explained at this year’s NFC Lisbon the origins of the crypto community tool kit, which industry niches are turning to its suite of products, and what’s next for the project since its token distribution event last February.

entry.title: Buying a Slice of H.R. Giger's 'Alien' Is Fine Art, Not Memorabilia: Particle CEO
entry.summary: With H.R. Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.
